title: Teacher-Student Interaction and Emotional Management Strategies in Online Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital device usage skills and beginner-level language learning experience
context.additional_context: Most learners are working professionals or hobby learners, combining real-time video sessions with asynchronous mobile learning activities.

learning_goals: Learners can apply interactive techniques using teachers' oral immediacy (e.g., real-time feedback, voice messages) in online environments.
Learners recognize teachers' online presence (systematic lecture design, discussion facilitation) and improve learning engagement by over 20%.
Learners can achieve a score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point scale for positive emotional value (course satisfaction, teacher trust).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
